conclusion: To find the power of the electromagnetic railgun when the projectile is launched, we need to calculate the kinetic energy of the projectile and the time it takes to travel along the rails.
Calculate the Lorentz force on the projectile using F = B I d, resulting in F = 0.2 N.
Calculate the acceleration using Newton's second law, resulting in a = 10 m/s^2.
Calculate the exit velocity using the kinematic equation v^2 = u^2 + 2aL, resulting in v ≈ 3.16 m/s.
Calculate the time to travel the rails using L = (1/2) a t^2, resulting in t ≈ 0.316 s.
Calculate the power using P = KE/t, resulting in P ≈ 0.316 W.
